name: Chest pain
description: Chest pain can signal a heart attack, angina, or other urgent medical issues and should never be ignored.
advice: Seek emergency care if chest pain is severe, sudden, or accompanied by shortness of breath, nausea, or sweating.

name: Palpitations
description: Palpitations are sensations of a racing or irregular heartbeat, which can be caused by anxiety, caffeine, or heart arrhythmias.
advice: Limit caffeine and stress; consult a cardiologist if palpitations occur frequently or cause discomfort.

name: High blood pressure
description: High blood pressure increases the risk of heart disease and stroke, often without noticeable symptoms.
advice: Regularly monitor your blood pressure and follow a low-sodium diet; consult your physician for ongoing management.

name: Low blood pressure
description: Low blood pressure can cause dizziness and fainting and may result from dehydration, medications, or heart conditions.
advice: Increase fluid intake and rise slowly from sitting or lying positions; see a doctor if symptoms persist.

name: Swelling in legs
description: Swelling in the legs might indicate fluid retention, poor circulation, or heart, kidney, or liver problems.
advice: Elevate your legs, reduce salt intake, and seek medical evaluation if swelling is persistent or painful.
